meanings.definition: To score more points than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: In the game, our team outscores the opponent.
meanings.sent2: The basketball team outscores their rivals in every match.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outscores the birds in gathering nuts for the winter.
meanings.sent4: Her determination outscores any obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sunflower outscores the other flowers with its vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: His speed outscores the other runners in the race.
meanings.sent2: The new technology outscores the old methods in efficiency.
meanings.sent3: The cat outscores the dog in catching mice around the house.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity outscores her peers in the art class.
meanings.sent5: The eagle outscores other birds in its ability to soar high in the sky.
